channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023090718
item.description:
Report E-2023090718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1814 Tigre release from a 52-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of material released to a 10’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor. The drum that released was shipped onto the customer by XPO prior to contractors’ arrival. The crew utilized vinegar solution to neutralize the impacted area. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023090307
item.description:
Report X-2023090307

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking by a preload unload manager. The manager placed hazmat in plastic bag/black bin and stored it in QA1. The pkg was upside down. DescribePack: All four jugs had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was placed right side up in a plastic bag/bin and processed in fumigator.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of brake cleaner ( un1993) releasing 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090254
item.description:
Report X-2023090254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was called to trailer 828815 and pkg. was in trailer wet and QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Closures came loose which caused the liquid to leak out and soil outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 40 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023082022
item.description:
Report X-2023082022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Steel drum with lug-type removable head and pail-style handle . No arrows on exterior. Top and bottom rims of drum and head dented, compromising seal and allowing leakage which damaged exterior labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023081963
item.description:
Report X-2023081963

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal paint cans in doublewall corrugated carton with corrugated liners and dividers. Only two lid clips per can. Lid lifted on one can and allowed contents to spill, soiling all cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

DescribePack: Closure came completely off and all the liquid leaked out of bottle causing the outer carton to soil.
